thoir ... uair air ... ... takes an hour to ... –
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. Dh’éirich Màiri aig deich mionaidean an déidh seachd, ach cha do dh’éirich Calum gus an robh e fichead mionaid gu ochd. Ged a bha Calum fada gun éiridh, cha tug e ach cairteal na h-uarach air faighinn deiseil, agus thàinig e a nuas an staidhre gu a bhracaist aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. Mary rose at ten minutes past seven, but Malcolm didn’t rise until it was twenty minutes to eight. Although Calum was late in rising, he only took a quarter of an hour to get ready, and he came downstairs to his breakfast a five minutes to eight. td. 182-3

éirich ... aig ... uairean ... ... rises at ... o’clock ... –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. td. 183

rach ... aig ... uair ... ... goes ... at ... o’clock ... –
Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. Thòisich am màthair air obair an taighe aig fichead mionaid an déidh sia, agus chaidh an athair a mach a bhiadhadh a’ chrùidh aig leth-uair an déidh sia.
The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. Their mother started on the housework at twenty minutes past six, and their father went out to feed the cattle at half past six. td. 183
